cx.corp.lacuna.core

Class LacunaBootstrap

  • java.lang.Object
    • cx.corp.lacuna.core.LacunaBootstrap

  • public final class LacunaBootstrap
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides easy access to the main Lacuna classes, bootstrapped to the correct platform. Contains static factory methods for creating new instances for specific and auto-detected platforms. Windows and Linux bootstraps are provided.

    The members are initialized in the following manner:

    TypeDescription
    MemoryReader A new MemoryReaderImpl instance with a platform-specific RawMemoryReader
    MemoryWriter A new MemoryWriterImpl instance with a platform-specific RawMemoryWriter
    NativeProcessEnumerator A new NativeProcessEnumeratorImpl instance with platform-specific PidEnumerator and NativeProcessCollector instances
    NativeProcessCollector A new platform-specific NativeProcessCollector
    See Also:
    MemoryReader, MemoryWriter, NativeProcessEnumerator, NativeProcessCollector

    • Method Detail

      • forCurrentPlatform

        public static LacunaBootstrap forCurrentPlatform()
        Gets a new LacunaBootstrap instance for the current platform.

        Platform detection is handled with the JNA library's Platform class in the following manner: if the current platform is a Windows platform, forWindows() is called, otherwise forLinux() is called.

        Returns:
        a new LacunaBootstrap instance bootstrapped for Windows if the current platform is Windows, otherwise an instance bootstrapped for Linux is returned.

      • forLinux

        public static LacunaBootstrap forLinux()
        Gets a new LacunaBootstrap instance for the Linux platform.
        Returns:
        a new instance bootstrapped for the Linux platform.

      • forWindows

        public static LacunaBootstrap forWindows()
        Gets a new LacunaBootstrap instance for the Windows platform.
        Returns:
        a new instance bootstrapped for the Windows platform.

        It is important to note that the Windows bootstrap uses native libraries to interact with the processes. These native libraries are not present on other platforms, meaning that this method will throw an exception if used on non-Windows platforms.

        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError - if the required native libraries are not found, for example when used on non-Windows platforms.
